critique: The document is a formal executive order regarding national emergency plans for atomic energy activities. It is primarily concerned with preparedness and coordination in the event of a national emergency, including an attack on the United States. The language is formal and bureaucratic, focusing on the responsibilities of the Atomic Energy Commission.The primary emotion conveyed would be fear (related to a potential attack) and surprise (related to the unexpected nature of an attack). There might also be a sense of disgust related to the potential consequences of a nuclear attack. There is no indication of joy. There might be a sense of sadness related to the potential consequences of a nuclear attack.Based on this, I will score the emotions accordingly and then revise based on the critique.
